data.name: Mortgage Offset Account
data.description: A Mortgage Offset account reduces the amount of interest you pay on your home loan. The amount within this account is offset against your home loan, meaning you only pay interest on the difference.

features.additionalInfo: You can self-serve your day-to-day banking needs via Bank Australia's App, Internet Banking or Phone Banking.
Know your money is safe with card controls, security alerts and more.

Use instore, online and withdraw local currency at millions of locations, everywhere Visa is accepted. Cards are enabled to support diverse needs with raised bumps on the left hand-side on the front face of the card.

features.additionalValue: Google, Samsung and Apple Pay available
features.additionalInfo: Leave your wallet behind and pay for the things you need with Google Pay/ Samsung Pay/ Apple Pay.
Notifications can be enabled in the App or through Internet Banking, allowing you to be alerted either by email, sms or through the App about your card/account activity.
With PayID you can forget your BSB and account number – simply use your mobile, email or ABN to receive payments. This account can be linked to a PayID.
There is no limit to the number of online, EFTPOS, ATM or staff assisted transactions you can make.

Round Up - When you make a transaction with your Visa debit card, you can decide whether you want the amount to be rounded to the nearest whole dollar amount, with the round up being credited from this account into your nominated Savings account or Credit Card.

Card Controls - Decide the features you want enabled on your card including card lock, digital wallet, pay wave, international transactions, ATM withdrawals or online/instore transactions and simply switch them on or off from your App or Internet Banking.

eligibility.additionalValue: Natural Person or In trust for a Natural Person
Residency Status - Must be an Australian citizen, permanent resident or have a valid Visa.

fees.name: Offset Service Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Charged monthly for offset accounts that are linked to a non-package loan.

fees.name: Dishonour Fee
fees.additionalInfo: When we dishonour a cheque or debit presented to us because there isn't enough money in your account.

fees.name: Domestic (“press credit”) cash withdrawal fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to any cash withdrawal transaction within Australia made using the “credit” option on a Visa Debit card.

fees.name: Exceeding available funds fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged on accounts when your balance falls below zero or your negative balance exceeds any agreed overdraft limit. Additional interest is charged on overdrawn amounts.

fees.name: Foreign Currency Conversion fee
fees.additionalInfo: We charge 3% of the value when you make a transaction that is converted by Visa from a foreign currency to Australian dollars and includes purchases made, overseas, in a currency other than Australian dollars, where the merchant is located overseas; or where the financial institution or entity processing the transaction is located overseas.

fees.name: Visa Foreign Cash Withdrawal Fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee that applies to any cash withdrawal transaction made with your Bank Australia Visa Debit Card outside Australia.
